value.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of creating deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: By using the Azure Cosmos DB Table API, you will benefit from the low latency, high availability, and scalability of Azure Cosmos DB in a Table storage application.

value.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Introduction to threat modeling
value.excerpt: Explore the four high-level steps of threat modeling.

value.title: Provide context with the right depth layer
value.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

value.title: Transcribe speech input to text
value.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

value.title: Translate speech with the speech service
value.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

value.title: Use containers for your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
value.excerpt: The Language Understanding (LUIS) container loads your trained or published Language Understanding model. As a LUIS app, the docker container provides access to the query predictions from the container's API endpoints

value.title: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Use entity behavior analytics in Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: Use entity behavior analytics in Azure Sentinel

value.title: Hunt for threats with Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: Hunt for threats with Azure Sentinel

value.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks

value.title: Work with mutable and partial data in Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Learn how to create transactions, manage memory, and use the cache-aside pattern with Azure Cache for Redis

value.title: Secure a Windows Virtual Desktop deployment
value.excerpt: Introduction to Microsoft security capabilities that can keep your applications and data secure in your Windows Virtual Desktop deployment.

value.title: Anomaly detection using machine learning in Azure Stream Analytics | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed serverless offering on Azure. With the new Anomaly Detection functions in Stream Analytics, the whole complexity associated with building and training custom machine learning (ML) models is reduced to a simple function call resulting in lower costs, faster time

value.title: Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes with GitOps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Lior Kamrat shows Scott Hanselman how Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes provides an easy way to apply GitOps configurations on Kubernetes clusters deployed outside of Azure, which enables you to control and govern those clusters and applications using GitHub repositories as the "single source of truth."

value.excerpt: Shubha Vijayasarathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Event Hubs, which makes data ingestion simple, secure, and scalable. value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion. value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HJeCqbbT-5s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Olivier Bloch joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure IoT and how it is more than just about connecting IoT devices and sending telemetry to the Cloud. They also talk about Azure IoT device topics such as twins, provisioning, and lifecycle management.  For more information, see:  Azure IoT Hub - http://aka.ms/azureiotgetstarted

value.title: Azure Security Center – Just-in-Time Network Access
value.excerpt: Cloud hosted VM’s are prime targets for RDP and SSH brute force attacks because management ports are typically left in an open state. With Just in Time network access, you can put any of your ports, not just management ports, into a default deny state until a user requires access. Once access is requested,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UOQb2FcdQnU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Best way to start Power Apps for a non-professional developer? | One Dev Question: Dona Sarkar
value.excerpt: Sometimes services like Power Apps can be daunting. In the One Dev Question series, Principal Cloud Advocate Dona Sarkar shares some tips for getting started and explains why you do not have to be a professional developer to use Power Apps.
